name: pepino
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an oval fruit with purple stripes, originally from South America, that tastes similar to a melon (= a large fruit with hard skin, sweet flesh, and a lot of seeds inside), or the plant on which this fruit grows: He says that the pepino is as easy to grow as a tomato. The pepino dulce comes from the Andes.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pepino is a fruit from South America with striped purple and yellow skin and a delicate flavour.The pepino tastes like a cross between a watermelon and a cantaloupe. The pepino tastes as its nickname, melon pear, suggests.
